name: Alaric Groß
history:
Alaric Groß was born on New Baden-Württemberg, a diasporan world originally settled by populations from neo-Germanic regions of Cradle. By the time of his birth, the planet had long since stabilized into a quiet, self-sufficient society shaped by tradition, local governance, and limited offworld involvement. Life there was orderly and predictable, and most residents remained within their communities for generations.

Alaric left as soon as he was able. Rather than pursuing a civilian trade, he enlisted with a locally operating free company that provided mechanized security and military support within the system. The company’s work was limited in scope and scale: border disputes between regional authorities, protection of infrastructure, and suppression of low-intensity armed conflict. Over several years, Alaric participated in a number of small campaigns and skirmishes, all confined to the surface of New Baden-Württemberg.

During this period, Alaric was taken on as a squire by a veteran pilot within the company. Under this mentorship, he developed a reputation for reliability and discipline. He was noted for maintaining cohesion under pressure, adhering closely to orders, and prioritizing the safety of his unit over individual initiative. His approach favored steady positioning and defensive action rather than aggressive maneuvering.

When hostilities on the planet diminished and contracts became scarce, the free company reduced its operations. Around this time, Union representatives conducting routine reviews of regional security forces identified several candidates for recruitment. Alaric was among those selected and accepted into Union service.

His transition into Union training was uneventful. While his background differed from that of academy-trained pilots, his prior experience translated cleanly into Union doctrine. He completed the required instruction and certification, qualifying as a mechanized chassis pilot under Union command. Following graduation, Alaric was assigned to the UNS-CV Rio Grande, an Ebro-class light carrier attached to a diplomatic mission to the planet Cressidium. The posting marked his first active deployment as a Union lancer.

systems.flavorDescription: Armory manufactured blades and axes are built to the highest standard of durability. In a pinch, some of them can even be used as an improvised shield against enemy attacks.
By installing additional armor plating, redundant firing circuits, and enhanced insulation to magazines the longevity of a frame’s armaments can be greatly enhanced.
The GMS Type-3 Projected Shield traps and denies incoming projectiles by projecting an aggressive, superpositional anti-ballistic barrier.

weapon.flavorDescription: A long sturdy shaft, topped with a miniature fusion torch. A simple weapon, early versions of the Fusion Pike hooked directly into a mech’s power reactor. The current version now contains a portable integrated battery while still maintaining the ability to siphon power from a mech’s reactor for extra power.

The latest innovations of GMS’s Type-II line of powered and energy weapons have produced a charged blade of staggering proportions. It is currently carried in the “Storm” line of superheavy equipment.

bondPowers.name: Champion's Heart
bondPowers.description: When you or an ally makes a skill check to help a vulnerable or powerless person, gain +1 ACCURACY and increased effect.

bondAnswers: An ironclad personal code of honor.
To preserve the traditions and uphold the values of your culture.
minorIdeal: I stood by a friend or ally despite dire consequences.

armor.flavorDescription: The heaviest hardsuits. They are always powered and up-armored with thick, composite armor. Heavy hardsuits often feature integrated weapons, powerful mobility suites, and – by augmenting their user’s strength – allow their user to field much heavier weapons than normal infantry can typically carry. Heavy hardsuits are in decline now that half-size chassis are popular, but they are still common among private militaries and middle-tier Diasporan armed forces.

weapons.flavorDescription: Heavy weapons are designed with the augmented strength of hardsuits in mind and include war hammers, mallets, rams, pikes, and heavy two-handed assault swords.
Light signature weapons might be oversized revolvers, braces of pistols, and submachine guns.

gear.flavorDescription: Dataplating is a general term for any comm-linked jewelry, subdermal netting, wearable jaw, brow, or maxillary plates, etc., that allows subvocal communication and persistent heads-up and augmented reality displays without wearing a helm. Dataplates can quickly translate nearly any language, and allow users to communicate with each other all but silently.
This clear, plastic-like sheet can be placed over the wounds of severely injured pilots. It instantly begins to stabilize them, injecting medicine and deploying nanites to stitch wounds shut.
